meanings.definition: A broad-spectrum systemic herbicide used to kill weeds, especially annual broadleaf weeds and grasses that compete with crops.
meanings.sent1: Farmers use glyphosate to get rid of pesky weeds in their fields.
meanings.sent2: The glyphosate effectively eliminates unwanted plants from the crop fields.
meanings.sent3: Why did the weed cross the road? To avoid the glyphosate on the other side!
meanings.sent4: The glyphosate acts like a silent assassin, targeting only the invasive plants.
meanings.sent5: The glyphosate spray painted the field green with its weed-killing power.

meanings.definition: The active ingredient in many herbicides, including the popular brand Roundup.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to check the label for glyphosate before buying any herbicide.
meanings.sent2: Roundup contains glyphosate, which is effective in killing unwanted plants.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous weeds tried to hide from the glyphosate, but it found them anyway!
meanings.sent4: In the battle against weeds, glyphosate is the ultimate weapon of choice.
meanings.sent5: The glyphosate ingredient in Roundup swiftly deals with any plant intruders.
